arts.ttl: The lowdown on Millwall 0 Coventry 1 - Lions’ unbeaten Championship run ended as Harris underwhelmed by bench impact
arts.sum: It felt like Millwall needed to make changes early in the second half as Coventry City had a spell and it looked as though first-team coach Adam Barrett was talking to the fourth official about substitutions just moments before Mason-Clark netted what proved to be the winner. Millwall lost at The Den for the first time since September 14 as Ephron Mason-Clark’s second-half goal gave Frank Lampard that winning feeling for the first time since being appointed Coventry City head coach.

arts.ttl: Coventry City boss Lampard pleased with commitment levels after 1-0 victory at Millwall
arts.sum: Former Chelsea and Everton boss Lampard was impressed with how his side defended their lead particularly as Millwall loaded the box late in the game searching for their equaliser. Conditions were tough and when it comes to defending your box at the end you have to do it.”

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard hails bodies on the line display as Coventry City secure first win under new boss at Millwall
arts.sum: Frank Lampard hailed his players' dogged and determined defending as Coventry City earned their first win under the new head coach – a narrow 1-0 victory at Millwall. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Coventry City player ratings at Millwall as gutsy battle sees Frank Lampard get first Sky Blues win - Andy Turner
arts.sum: Coventry started the second half in determined fashion, enjoying a couple of corners before finally finding the back of the net when Rudoni put the ball into the box and Mason-Clark got the final touch at the far post to give the visitors the 63rd minute lead. The home side attempted a fight-back but City defended really well while attacking changes meant they also went close to increasing their lead, the best chance falling to Bobby Thomas who headed onto the post from a corner.

arts.ttl: Ephron Mason-Clark fires Coventry to victory over Millwall
arts.sum: Frank Lampard claimed his first win as Sky Blues boss.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes four changes to his Coventry City side to face Millwall at The Den
arts.sum: City: Brad Collins; Milan van Ewijk, Bobby Thomas, Joel Latibeaudiere, Jake Bidwell; Victor Torp, Ben Sheaf; Tatsuhiro Sakamoto, Jack Rudoni, Ephron Mason-Clark; Ellis Simms. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: What Frank Lampard ‘loves’ about Coventry City man who's created quite a stir
arts.sum: Frank Lampard admits he’s “very excited” about nurturing and developing the raw and explosive talents of Coventry City striker Norman Bassette. Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard instructs Coventry City trio treading disciplinary line ahead of 'fierce' Millwall encounter
arts.sum: Get the latest Coventry City news sent straight to your phone by joining our Sky Blues WhatsApp group. All three are on four yellow cards in the league but the good news is that the Sky Blues players only have to get through the next 90 minutes before the match ban cut-off point, after which the suspension threat rolls on until they rack of ten.

arts.ttl: Frank Lampard makes recruitment admission as Coventry City work towards transfer window
arts.sum: Asked by CoventryLive if he’s already started to identify areas on the pitch where the team could benefit from a bit more strength in depth come January, the City boss said: “Only the first feelings of that because we have had a good week’s training and games, potentially, can really give you a good feeling of the balance of the team. Frank Lampard has begun his assessment of Coventry City’s squad with a view to identifying areas that may need strengthening come the January transfer window.
